intro: Ageratina purpusii, commonly known as the white mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features fluffy, white or pale blue flower clusters that resemble mist, giving it its common name. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Ageratina purpusii is often found in moist, shaded environments and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
